  • TLAB

    In addition to declaring a $1/share special dividend, Tellabs (NASDAQ:TLAB) announces it has...

    In addition to declaring a $1/share special dividend, Tellabs (NASDAQ:TLAB) announces it has named Dan Kelly its permanent CEO. Kelly became interim CEO in June, stepping in for Rob Pullen, who died of cancer in July. Prior to June, Kelly was Tellabs' R&D chief. Shares are halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU): Q3 EPS of -$0.67 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $76.9M (+84% Y/Y). Shares...

    Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU): Q3 EPS of -$0.67 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $76.9M (+84% Y/Y). Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) -11.1% AH after disclosing it has amended its agreement with Facebook...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) -11.1% AH after disclosing it has amended its agreement with Facebook (NASDAQ:FB). The most worrisome line: "Facebook will no longer be prohibited from developing its own games." Facebook has said it's not interested in being a game developer, but as of March 31, 2013, it won't be legally obligated on that count. The amendment also frees Zynga of the obligation to display Facebook ads or use Facebook credits on Zynga.com and other company properties, and of having Facebook be its "exclusive social platform."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 17 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) +2.6% AH after COO Richard Goudis discloses he bought 45,516 shares on Nov....

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) +2.6% AH after COO Richard Goudis discloses he bought 45,516 shares on Nov. 29 at a price of $43.89. The purchase increases the size of Goudis' stake to 180K shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • OVTI

    More on OmniVision: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $390M-$425M and EPS of $0.33-$0.46, mostly...

    More on OmniVision: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $390M-$425M and EPS of $0.33-$0.46, mostly above a consensus of $365.2M and $0.35. FQ2 gross margin fell 250 bps Q/Q and 1400 bps Y/Y to 16.6%, almost certainly due to surging Apple orders. Judging by guidance, margin pressure will continue in FQ3. OmniVision says co-founder Raymond Wu is re-joining the company as president. Wu was in charge of sales and marketing before resigning in '06. OVTI now -3.1% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM

    Reaffirming its FY2012 EPS growth forecast of 13%, or $3.24/share, Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) sees...

    Reaffirming its FY2012 EPS growth forecast of 13%, or $3.24/share, Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) sees softer business in China in Q4 leading to negative (-4%) same-store sales growth. Shares -4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -3.3% AH after a company spokesman tells Bloomberg Andrew Mason won't be...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -3.3% AH after a company spokesman tells Bloomberg Andrew Mason won't be replaced as CEO over the near-term. Between today's AH move and Tuesday's, the Street has made its feelings on the matter pretty clear. Groupon held a board meeting today. (Mason's remarks)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • RIC

    Richmont Mines (NYSEMKT:RIC) -15.7% AH after announcing the immediate closure of the Francoeur...

    Richmont Mines (NYSEMKT:RIC) -15.7% AH after announcing the immediate closure of the Francoeur Mine in Quebec, prompting a pre-tax write-off of C$11M-C$13M, mostly during Q4. Exploration activities on the Wasamac gold project are suspended. Gold production for 2013 is revised to 65K-70K oz. vs. 85K-95K previously.

  • SVU

    A hitch in Cerberus Capital's funding is stalling its pursuit of Supervalu (SVU -15.9%),...

    A hitch in Cerberus Capital's funding is stalling its pursuit of Supervalu (SVU -15.9%), Bloomberg has sources reporting. It comes down to the post-acquisition debt-revenue mix - and if Supervalu has to sell assets on its own, big tax payments lie ahead.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 9 Comments
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL -2.9%) explored selling itself earlier this year but backed out after the...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL -2.9%) explored selling itself earlier this year but backed out after the buyer balked over the asking price, WSJ reports. At a market cap of ~$5B and with $1.6B in debt WLL reported as of Sept. 30, the buyer would have needed to commit at least $6.6B for a full buyout, and the premium paid in U.S. oil and gas deals has averaged 41% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +5.1%) is posting a decent gain after launching a music search engine to complement...

    Qihoo (QIHU +5.1%) is posting a decent gain after launching a music search engine to complement its Web search engine, thereby bolstering its efforts to compete with Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU). There's a good chance Qihoo's product will end up displacing the music engine provided by Sohu's (NASDAQ:SOHU) Sogou unit for Qihoo's hao.360.cn portal. Baidu currently offers China's most popular music engine - it recently drove a rival offering from Google out of the market. (more on Qihoo-Baidu)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM

    Contango Oil & Gas (MCF +1.7%) names 35-year energy industry veteran Joe Romano as CEO and President, as former CEO Kenneth Peak remains as Chairman while on medical leave.

    Usana Health Sciences (USNA -4.2%) shares spike lower after Citron Research comes out negative...

    Usana Health Sciences (USNA -4.2%) shares spike lower after Citron Research comes out negative on the company: "While Usana doesn't push the legal envelope of dubious marketing claims like Nu Skin, it stands on even shakier ground because it lacks even a 'direct sales' license for its dietary supplement products" in China.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • MLNX

    EZchip (EZCH -2.1%) is off a bit following a downgrade to Sell from Chardan Capital, which (like...

    EZchip (EZCH -2.1%) is off a bit following a downgrade to Sell from Chardan Capital, which (like many others) is worried about soft wireline service provider capex. EZChip rallied 3 weeks ago after providing a better-than-feared Q3 report (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • ENTR

    Entropic (ENTR +5.1%) is posting big gains after D.A. Davidson's Aalok Shah claims FCC data...

    Entropic (ENTR +5.1%) is posting big gains after D.A. Davidson's Aalok Shah claims FCC data indicates Comcast's new X13-H IPTV set-top box features Entropic connectivity (presumably MoCA home networking) and system-on-chip parts. Shah thinks Entropic could collect $8-$10/unit, and that Comcast may begin deploying the X13-H in 1H13. D.A. upgraded Entropic in October on account of an expected Time Warner Cable design win.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +47.9%) shares skyrocket ~50%, apparently due to a report from...

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +47.9%) shares skyrocket ~50%, apparently due to a report from EMPR.com that its Nexafed drug will be available soon. Nexafed is an immediate-release next generation pseudoephedrine tablet which combines nasal congestion relief with ACUR's IMPEDE technology that disrupts the conversion of pseudoephedrine into methamphetamine.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6%) has given up some of the premarket gains it saw due to Goldman's...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6%) has given up some of the premarket gains it saw due to Goldman's upgrade, but is still sharply higher. Goldman only gives BlackBerry 10 a 30% chance of success, though it does see the OS delivering a 21% Y/Y increase in RIM's ASP in FY14 (ends in Feb.) to $270. It now expects RIM to earn $0.20/share in FY14, but foresees a $0.62/share loss for FY15, as declining emerging markets sales weigh on results. IDC recently estimated both iOS and Android are now seeing stronger business purchase activity than BlackBerry.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 8 Comments
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -3.5%) trades lower on a move attributed to building chatter that Richard Schulze...

    Best Buy (BBY -3.5%) trades lower on a move attributed to building chatter that Richard Schulze is struggling to line up financing for a deal to buy out the retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P +7.1%) is up strongly after Albert Fried's Rich Tullo estimates ~60% of House...

    Pandora (P +7.1%) is up strongly after Albert Fried's Rich Tullo estimates ~60% of House Judiciary Committee members are in favor of the Internet Radio Fairness Act or undecided, following yesterday's testimony. He thinks a Congressional vote will likely happen between March and June 2013. Pandora, which had a whopping 58% of its float shorted as of Nov. 15, issues its FQ3 report on Dec. 4.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • PGNX

    Progenics Pharma (PGNX +9%) soars on its public offering of 11M shares at $2 each, a 5.2%...

    Progenics Pharma (PGNX +9%) soars on its public offering of 11M shares at $2 each, a 5.2% discount to yesterday's closing price, as it seeks to raise funds for R&D and other general purposes. PGNX is off 80% since July, when the FDA asked for more data on its Relistor treatment for opioid-induced constipation in patients with chronic, non-cancer pain.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC -2.1%) is trading lower after Citi and Goldman slash their estimates. Goldman,...

    Intel (INTC -2.1%) is trading lower after Citi and Goldman slash their estimates. Goldman, reiterating a Sell, thinks Intel's gross margin will probably drop in the coming quarters due to high inventories and declining ASPs. Meanwhile, AMD (AMD +7.4%) is rallying for the second day in a row after announcing plans to sell and lease back its Austin campus, though shares remain down sharply on the year. 27.9% of AMD's float was shorted as of Nov. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 9 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday (WDAY -3.8%) has given back yesterday's AH gains, as a steep valuation overshadow a...

    Workday (WDAY -3.8%) has given back yesterday's AH gains, as a steep valuation overshadow a strong FQ3 beat and solid FQ4 guidance. SA's Robert Broens notes the mid-point of Workday's revenue guidance range implies 10.6% Q/Q growth, down from FQ3's 15.8%, though judging by the FQ3 beat, the company might be playing it safe. During Workday's earning call, the company noted its customer base rose by 31 to 356, that the average length of contracts signed was 3.6 years, and that it's now billing less up-front, something that hurts unearned revenue over the near-term.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NS +4.2%) shares pop higher following a management update (Briefing.com): NS is...

    NuStar Energy (NS +4.2%) shares pop higher following a management update (Briefing.com): NS is in advanced talks with an interested buyer for its San Antonio refinery; four internal growth projects in the Eagle Ford shale have been completed; interest from its Niobrara Shale play could increase as additional production comes online in future years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +15%) extends its rally after beating the estimates of analysts by a wide...

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +15%) extends its rally after beating the estimates of analysts by a wide margin with its Q3 report and naming a new CEO. Piper Jaffray still sees a frothy run to $10 for shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI -2.1%) is down on an up day after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne...

    Activision (ATVI -2.1%) is down on an up day after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee, which is worried sales of Call of Duty: Black Ops II are slowing. Activision rallied two weeks ago after announcing sales of Black Ops II topped $500M in its first 24 hours of availability. GameStop (GME -1.5%) is also lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • GES

    Shares of Guess (GES +3.4%) ride higher after the company is lifted to Overweight by Piper...

    Shares of Guess (GES +3.4%) ride higher after the company is lifted to Overweight by Piper Jaffray on the heels of its Q3 earnings report and special dividend gift to shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • SMTC

    Analog chipmaker Semtech (SMTC +13.8%) has soared and is near its 52-week high after soundly...

    Analog chipmaker Semtech (SMTC +13.8%) has soared and is near its 52-week high after soundly beating FQ3 estimates and guiding for FQ4 revenue of $146M-$152M vs. a $147.6M consensus, pleasing investors on edge over troubles faced by peers. Semtech's gross margin rose 970 bps Q/Q to 59.2%, and is expected to be in the range of 58.3%-58.9% in seasonally weak FQ4. Micrel (MCRL +2.9%), Microsemi (MSCC +2.9%), and Intersil (ISIL +1.6%) might be rallying in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -14.7%) is nosediving following its FQ4 report. Though the...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -14.7%) is nosediving following its FQ4 report. Though the surplus/salvage auction site beat estimates, it guided for FY13 EPS of $2.05-$2.23, mostly below a $2.20 consensus. FY13 gross merchandise volume is expected to total $1.1B-$1.2B, up from FY12's $864M. Liquidity says it's maintaining a cautious outlook due to macro concerns, and now expects recently-acquired GoIndustry to hurt FY13 EPS, after previously forecasting the opposite. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • IAC

    InterActiveCorp (IACI +3.2%) opens higher after catching an upgrade to Outperform from Wells...

    InterActiveCorp (IACI +3.2%) opens higher after catching an upgrade to Outperform from Wells Fargo, which thinks concerns about the mobile shift and Ask.com traffic trends are baked in following a recent selloff. The firm believes Ask.com benefits from the fact its users are "generally mobile laggards," though it is worried about the competitive risk posed by search toolbars.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (NASDAQ:HERO) +8% premarket after the company releases its fleet status report...

    Hercules Offshore (NASDAQ:HERO) +8% premarket after the company releases its fleet status report showing a jump in November U.S. average contract days to 232 vs. 174 in the prior month. Yesterday's 4.5% gain was sparked by Deutsche Bank's enthusiastic recommendation as the play most leveraged to its bottom call in natural gas prices. Shares are upgraded to Outperform at Stephens.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • TJX

    Shares of TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) slump premarket, down 1.6% premarket, after a 3% gain in...

    Shares of TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) slump premarket, down 1.6% premarket, after a 3% gain in same-store sales in November falls below the expectations of analysts calling for a 3.6% rise. The company says it "stayed out" of the fray of Black Friday promotional activity, but maintains it saw strong traffic numbers and improving trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures are higher and continuing from where shares left off yesterday...

    Market preview: Stock futures are higher and continuing from where shares left off yesterday after both sides in the fiscal cliff negotiations expressed optimism that a deal can be done. The S&P benchmark is +0.4%. Markets are likely to sway with each installment of the "he said she said" saga until agreement is reached. RIM bounds 11.5% higher in the wake of an upgrade from GS, although Tiffany slumps 7.9% following its earnings report. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Pending Home Sales, Kansas City Fed Mfg Survey
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ +5.9% after new CEO Ralph Schmitt tells Reuters his company hasn't seen any NAND flash...

    OCZ +5.9% after new CEO Ralph Schmitt tells Reuters his company hasn't seen any NAND flash supply issues lately, after struggling with them this summer. He adds OCZ, recently hammered by warnings, a delayed 10-Q, and an SEC investigation, is in talks to raise capital and is open to "strategic alternatives," but downplays the possibility of a sale. Schmitt recognizes OCZ's solid-state drives can't compete on price against NAND manufacturers such as Micron and Samsung, something that has led it to focus on differentiated products such as its new Vector line.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    More on Barnes & Noble's (NYSE:BKS) FQ2: Store closures drove the firm's revenue haul lower...

    More on Barnes & Noble's (NYSE:BKS) FQ2: Store closures drove the firm's revenue haul lower than from a year ago but a 38% Y/Y jump in Nook Digital Content sales is where the future looks promising. EBITDA is higher in the retail segment, to partially offset a slip in College and lower EBITDA losses at Nook. Conference call scheduled for 9:00 AM (webcast). BKS -1.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • KR

    More on Kroger's (NYSE:KR) Q3: The company rode broad sales gains outside of fuel to an improved...

    More on Kroger's (NYSE:KR) Q3: The company rode broad sales gains outside of fuel to an improved quarter. For FY12, Kroger lifts its EPS guidance to $2.44-$2.46 from a prior range of $2.35-$2.42. Exec say the grocery store chain will be focused on deploying capital to further improve growth and improve ROIC. KR +4.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM

  • GPS

    Holiday season warning for retail? The three heavyweight retailers to report November same-store...

    Holiday season warning for retail? The three heavyweight retailers to report November same-store sales all came in with disappointing marks. While Macy's and Target actually saw sales slip during the month, Gap showed a positive reading below expectations. The quick buzz from analysts is that a deeper trend than just a bump in the road from Hurricane Sandy could be in play. GPS -2.4%, TGT -2.9%, M -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM

    Macy's (NYSE:M) Nov same-store sales: -0.7%. Shares -2.9% premarket.

    Research in Motion (RIMM) soars 11.9% premarket on a Goldman upgrade to Buy with price target of...

    Research in Motion (RIMM) soars 11.9% premarket on a Goldman upgrade to Buy with price target of $16 (from $9). "For the first time in 3 years, we think out-year Street estimates are too low."

  • TIF

    More on Tiffany's (NYSE:TIF) Q3: The retailer saw steady sales gains in the Americas region,...

    More on Tiffany's (NYSE:TIF) Q3: The retailer saw steady sales gains in the Americas region, Asia-Pacific, and Europe but its gross margin rate fell 160 bps to 54.4%. Tiffany didn't keep pace with the overall retail sector, seeing Internet sales only increase 3% during the period. The company sets a "cautious" outlook with global macroeconomic factors in play, saying it sees FY12 EPS of $3.20-$3.40, lower than prior guidance of $3.55-$3.70 and short of the consensus mark of analysts calling for $3.60. TIF -12.2%. (PR)

  • Asian and European stocks mostly follow U.S. shares higher after President Obama and House...

    Asian and European stocks mostly follow U.S. shares higher after President Obama and House Speaker John Boehner made optimistic noises that Washington will be able to reach a deal over the fiscal cliff. However, China continues the bear run that has seen stocks lose around 18% this year. Japan +1%, Hong Kong +1%, China -0.5%, India +1.4%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.9%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.8%, Frankfurt +0.6%, Milan +1.3%, Madrid +1.3%.
